result.execSummary:
The defendant Salvador Uribe was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to costs. Balance to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

No Contact with Victim A. No possession of dangerous weapons (e.g. Knives, firearms, etc)  Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent. 
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

records.addlTxt: Letter from Atty. Andy Herbers advising the Office of the State Public Defender no longer represents Defendant.
with Elements of criminal offenses and pre-trial offer to which plea is being entered.

8:15 AM Defendant Salvador Uribe in court, in custody.  Attorney J Andrew Herbers Jr. in court for Salvador Uribe.  Prosecuting attorney Christian Farina in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Cases called for plea and sentencing.
State places offer on the record.
Court conducts plea colloquy.

In case 22CM456:
Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty. 
Count 2 is Dismissed and read in.

In case 22CM1243:
Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 2.  Court finds defendant guilty. 
Count 1 is Dismissed and read in.

State and Defense make sentencing recommendations.
Defendant makes statement to the court.

Court orders the following:

In case 22CM456:

IMPOSED AND STAYED: 

JAIL:  60 Days -Straight-time.
0  Days Credit.

TERM ON PROBATION:  2 YEARS; 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
*AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
*Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.'s ; 
*No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia;
*Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent; 
*No contact with:  Victim A; 
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done;
*No possession of dangerous weapons (e.g. knives, firearms, etc.)

COSTS:  $243
DOMESTIC VIOLENCE SURCHARGE: $100
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $200 
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Cash on hand to be applied to costs and surcharges. Balance to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

In case 22CM1243:
IMPOSED AND STAYED: 

JAIL:  6 Months -Straight-time.
88 Days Credit.
Consecutive to 22CM456 if revoked; 

TERM ON PROBATION:  2 YEARS; 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
*AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
*Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.'s ; 
*No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia;
*Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent; 
*No contact with:  Victim A; 
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done;
*No possession of dangerous weapons (e.g. knives, firearms, etc.)

CONDITION TIME: 60 DAYS, STAYED; to be used at agent's discretion.  Agent to determine with or without non working hours.  

COSTS:  $243
DOMESTIC VIOLENCE SURCHARGE: $100
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $200 
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

Court quashes the warrant in 22CM1243.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 2, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Attorney Herbers is requesting a short turn around for plea and sentencing.
Court grants.
